intro: Oxytropis bella, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, hard pods that contain seeds. Oxytropis bella is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
